cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles WNW of Nassau, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the north-western Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and paralleling the Florida east coast before approaching the Georgia–South Carolina coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Georgia/South Carolina coast in the vicinity of Savannah, GA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (just north of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from north of Golden Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC (includes all Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. Atlantic coast from central Florida through Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (62% chance), and hurricane-force gusts (25% chance of sustained 50-kt winds) are possible as Matthew nears the Georgia coast late Friday night into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation of 6–9 ft above ground level possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance, if peak surge occurs at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated amounts to 12 inches possible, leading to flash flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents, coastal flooding, and possible brief tornadoes in rainbands.
